meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by dynamics or energy.
meanings.sent1: The dynamistic performance of the athletes amazed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The dynamistic nature of the storm caused trees to sway violently.
meanings.sent3: The dynamistic dance moves of the penguin brought smiles to everyone watching.
meanings.sent4: Her dynamistic personality lit up the room like a burst of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The dynamistic explosion of colors in the sunset painted the sky in breathtaking hues.

meanings.definition: Having the power or ability to produce change or motion.
meanings.sent1: The dynamistic engine propelled the car forward with great speed.
meanings.sent2: The dynamistic leader inspired positive changes in the community.
meanings.sent3: The dynamistic toy robot kept surprising the children with its movements.
meanings.sent4: His dynamistic ideas sparked a revolution in the field of technology.
meanings.sent5: The dynamistic wind turbines generated clean energy for the entire town.

meanings.definition: Involving the study of forces and motion.
meanings.sent1: The dynamistic experiments in the physics lab fascinated the students.
meanings.sent2: The dynamistic analysis of the car crash revealed important details.
meanings.sent3: The dynamistic roller coaster design thrilled the amusement park visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her dynamistic approach to problem-solving always led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The dynamistic study of planetary orbits revolutionized our understanding of the universe.
